segment.source: Work with Product Keys and Activation
segment.target: Work with Product Keys and Activation

segment.source: Work with Product Keys and Activation
segment.target: Work with Product Keys and Activation

segment.source: Work with Product Keys and Activation
segment.target: Work with Product Keys and Activation

segment.source: You can enter a product key during an automated installation of Windows® by including it in your answer file.
segment.target: You can enter a product key during an automated installation of Windows® by including it in your answer file.

segment.source: You can also use product keys to select an image to install during an automated Windows installation.
segment.target: You can also use product keys to select an image to install during an automated Windows installation.

segment.source: In this Topic
segment.target: In this Topic

segment.source: Select Which Windows Edition to Install
segment.target: Select Which Windows Edition to Install

segment.source: Activate Windows
segment.target: Activate Windows

segment.source: Select Which Windows Edition to Install
segment.target: Select Which Windows Edition to Install

segment.source: To select a Windows edition to install, you can do one of the following:
segment.target: To select a Windows edition to install, you can do one of the following:

segment.source: Install Windows manually, without an answer file.
segment.target: Install Windows manually, without an answer file.

segment.source: Windows Setup installs the default edition from the Windows product DVD.
segment.target: Windows Setup installs the default edition from the Windows product DVD.

segment.source: Install Windows with an answer file, and include a product key in Microsoft-Windows-SetupUserDataProductKey.
segment.target: Install Windows with an answer file, and include a product key in Microsoft-Windows-SetupUserDataProductKey.

segment.source: Each product key is specific to a Windows edition.
segment.target: Each product key is specific to a Windows edition.

segment.source: Entering the product key in this setting does not activate Windows.
segment.target: Entering the product key in this setting does not activate Windows.

segment.source: Install Windows with an answer file, and then manually type in a product key during Windows Setup.
segment.target: Install Windows with an answer file, and then manually type in a product key during Windows Setup.

segment.source: The product key selects a Windows edition to install.
segment.target: The product key selects a Windows edition to install.

segment.source: Warning
segment.target: Warning

segment.source: If you have multiple Windows images with the same Windows edition that are stored in the same Windows image file (.wim), you can use the setting: Microsoft-Windows-SetupImageInstallOSImageInstallFrom to differentiate between them.
segment.target: If you have multiple Windows images with the same Windows edition that are stored in the same Windows image file (.wim), you can use the setting: Microsoft-Windows-SetupImageInstallOSImageInstallFrom to differentiate between them.

segment.source: You must still provide a product key using one of the methods listed in the previous list.
segment.target: You must still provide a product key using one of the methods listed in the previous list.

segment.source: For information about managing Windows product keys when changing the Windows image to a higher edition, see Change the Windows Image to a Higher Edition Using DISM.
segment.target: For information about managing Windows product keys when changing the Windows image to a higher edition, see Change the Windows Image to a Higher Edition Using DISM.

segment.source: Activate Windows
segment.target: Activate Windows

segment.source: To automatically activate Windows by using a product key, you can do one of the following:
segment.target: To automatically activate Windows by using a product key, you can do one of the following:

segment.source: Use the Microsoft-Windows-Shell-Setup unattend setting.
segment.target: Use the Microsoft-Windows-Shell-Setup unattend setting.

segment.source: You can use either a single-use product key or a Volume License Multiple Activation Key.
segment.target: You can use either a single-use product key or a Volume License Multiple Activation Key.

segment.source: For more information, see the Volume Activation Planning Guide.
segment.target: For more information, see the Volume Activation Planning Guide.

segment.source: The product key used to activate Windows must match the Windows edition that you install.
segment.target: The product key used to activate Windows must match the Windows edition that you install.

segment.source: If you use a product key to select a Windows edition, we recommend using the same key to activate Windows, so that the edition you install is the same as the edition that you activate.
segment.target: If you use a product key to select a Windows edition, we recommend using the same key to activate Windows, so that the edition you install is the same as the edition that you activate.

segment.source: Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEMs) can use OEM-specific activation tools.
segment.target: Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEMs) can use OEM-specific activation tools.

segment.source: If a product key isn’t provided prior to Out-Of-Box Experience (OOBE), then OOBE will prompt the end user for a product key.
segment.target: If a product key isn’t provided prior to Out-Of-Box Experience (OOBE), then OOBE will prompt the end user for a product key.

segment.source: If the end user skips this during OOBE, the user will be reminded later to enter a valid product key.
segment.target: If the end user skips this during OOBE, the user will be reminded later to enter a valid product key.

segment.source: Warning
segment.target: Warning

segment.source: In most Windows 8 deployment scenarios, you no longer have to use the answer file setting to reset the Windows Product Activation clock when you run the Sysprep command multiple times on a computer.
segment.target: In most Windows 8 deployment scenarios, you no longer have to use the answer file setting to reset the Windows Product Activation clock when you run the Sysprep command multiple times on a computer.

segment.source: In Windows 8, the setting is used to specify the Windows licensing state.
segment.target: In Windows 8, the setting is used to specify the Windows licensing state.

segment.source: If you specify a retail product key or volume license product key, Windows is automatically activated.
segment.target: If you specify a retail product key or volume license product key, Windows is automatically activated.

segment.source: You can run the Sysprep command up to 8 additional times on a single Windows image.
segment.target: You can run the Sysprep command up to 8 additional times on a single Windows image.

segment.source: After running Sysprep 8 times on a Windows 8 image, you must recreate your Windows image.
segment.target: After running Sysprep 8 times on a Windows 8 image, you must recreate your Windows image.

segment.source: For more information about Windows components and settings that you can add to an answer file, see the Unattended Windows Setup Reference.
segment.target: For more information about Windows components and settings that you can add to an answer file, see the Unattended Windows Setup Reference.
